content: Hi! I worked through 5 chapters of "theorem proving in Lean 4", and also read chapter 12 in which they state that propositional extensionality blocks normalization. My question is: what is a normalization? They gave example "every expression of type Nat is a numeral", which I understand, but this is an example, not a definition. What is a normal form of an expression of more general inductive or functional type? And, morally, why propositional extensionality somehow "blocks" it?
The reference has an entry on normal forms and propext including blocking example, does that help?
Yes, exactly what I need, thank you
